introduction: Madd means 'to stretch' or 'lengthen.' It refers to elongating the sound of one of three Madd letters: Alif (ا), Waw (و), or Yaa (ي). The length depends on what follows the Madd letter — specifically whether a Hamzah (ء) or Sukoon follows.

types.description: The basic, natural elongation. Occurs when a Madd letter is NOT followed by a Hamzah or Sukoon. Always exactly 2 beats.
types.trigger: Madd letter with no Hamzah or Sukoon after it

examples.rule_applied: Madd Tabee'i — Alif after Fathah, 2 beats
Madd Tabee'i — Waw after Dammah, 2 beats

types.description: When a Madd letter is followed by a Hamzah (ء) WITHIN THE SAME WORD. Must be elongated for 4-5 beats.
types.trigger: Madd letter + Hamzah in same word

examples.rule_applied: Madd Muttasil — Alif followed by Hamzah in same word, 4-5 beats
Madd Muttasil — Waw followed by Hamzah in same word, 4-5 beats

types.description: When a Madd letter is at the END of one word and the NEXT word begins with a Hamzah. Elongated for 4-5 beats (Hafs allows shortening to 4).
types.trigger: Madd letter at end of word + Hamzah at start of next word

examples.rule_applied: Madd Munfasil — Alif at end of first word, Hamzah at start of second, 4-5 beats
Madd Munfasil — Waw at end of first word, Hamzah at start of second

types.description: When a Madd letter is followed by a letter that receives a temporary Sukoon because the reciter pauses or stops. Can be held for 2, 4, or 6 beats. If not stopping, it reverts to Madd Tabee'i (2 beats).
types.trigger: Madd letter + letter given temporary Sukoon when stopping

examples.rule_applied: Madd 'Arid — Yaa followed by temporary Sukoon when stopping, 2/4/6 beats
Madd 'Arid — Waw followed by temporary Sukoon when stopping

types.description: When a Madd letter is followed by a PERMANENT Sukoon (or Shaddah) in the same word. Always exactly 6 beats. This is the longest Madd. Subdivided into Kalimi (word-based) and Harfi (letter-based, in Muqatta'at letters at beginnings of surahs).
types.trigger: Madd letter + permanent Sukoon/Shaddah in same word

subtypes.description: Madd letter followed by a letter with Shaddah within the same word.
Madd letter followed by Sukoon (no Shaddah) in same word. Very rare — occurs only in آلْآنَ (twice in Surah Yunus).

types.description: When a Hamzah PRECEDES a Madd letter (the reverse of Muttasil/Munfasil). The original form had two Hamzahs, but the second was replaced by a Madd letter. Held for 2 beats.

examples.rule_applied: Madd Badal — Hamzah preceded the Alif, 2 beats
Madd Badal — Hamzah preceded the Yaa, 2 beats

types.description: Applies to Waw Sakinah or Yaa Sakinah preceded by Fathah (not their matching vowels). Only elongated when stopping on the word. These are the Leen letters (soft letters).
types.trigger: Waw/Yaa Sakinah preceded by Fathah, when stopping

examples.rule_applied: Madd Leen — Yaa Sakinah preceded by Fathah, elongated when stopping
Madd Leen — Waw Sakinah preceded by Fathah, elongated when stopping
